| An apprentice:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [monst.c#line3207](/wiki/Monst.c#line3207 "Monst.c")                                 |

The **apprentice**, @, is a [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"). They are capable of [arcane spellcasting](/wiki/Monster_spell#Mage_Spells "Monster spell").

Apprentices can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") to become [wizards](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1).

## Encyclopedia entry

Ebenezum walked before me along the closest thing we could find to a path in these overgrown woods. Every few paces he would pause, so that I, burdened with a pack stuffed with arcane and heavy paraphernalia, could catch up with his wizardly strides. He, as usual, carried nothing, preferring, as he often said, to keep his hands free for quick conjuring and his mind free for the thoughts of a mage.

\[ A Dealing with Demons, by Craig Shaw Gardner ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 967](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/mondata.c#L967)

html:
Apprentice

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ apprentice
Difficulty 8
Attacks Weapon 1d6, Spellcasting (arcane)
@ apprentice
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Weapon 1d6, Spellcasting (arcane)

Base level 5
Base experience 71
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 30
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

An apprentice:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3207

The apprentice, @, is a Wizard quest guardian. They are capable of arcane spellcasting.

Apprentices can grow up to become wizards.[1].

Encyclopedia entry

Ebenezum walked before me along the closest thing we could find to a path in these overgrown woods. Every few paces he would pause, so that I, burdened with a pack stuffed with arcane and heavy paraphernalia, could catch up with his wizardly strides. He, as usual, carried nothing, preferring, as he often said, to keep his hands free for quick conjuring and his mind free for the thoughts of a mage.

[ A Dealing with Demons, by Craig Shaw Gardner ]

References

  1. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 967
